column4: musicgreg: when you right click the application, go to scripts and then mount iso.
musicgreg: or what samantha wrote for terminal command.
musicgreg: named with a blank?  what do you mean?
there's a space in the name of the folder
I try to mount it with right click and then "mount", and the thing is, I can mount it on a windows machine
I tried every mount applications I found, and they told me the same thing.
is there a way for me to know which iso format is it? Cos all I've read was that it wasn't one particular format. But nothing tells me what it is...
sorry i'm not english, I try hard ^
no it more something like media/doc 2/iso.iso
what do you call the space between two words?
ok I mounted it, and a new icon appeared with the name of the iso
and when i open it, there's no file inside
well I got the from burning a dvd which i don't have anymore...
nevermind, thank you anyway for your time
